programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A man shows up and claims to be Stanley's son. Stanley admits to know his mother, but doesn't remember the night that she claimed to conceive her son. Roper goes to talk to a friend who was with him at the time to find out if the claims are true.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen adores the Brookes' boy, David, which leads her to feel she and Stanley could adopt a baby. Stanley is against it. Still, she calls an agency and sets up a home interview.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: After James falls for a young artist, Jack tries to save him from heartbreak.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: In search of a peaceful work atmosphere, Henry mistakenly takes studio space at Wainwright Publishing.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: While Henry pushes Jackie towards marriage, she pushes her steady, Bill St. George, towards fatherhood.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe's misadventures with unemployment and workmen's compensation puts Jackie and Sara at odds with Henry.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe befriends a fifteen year old shoplifter and invites him to the Rush household.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry's plans to send Andrew to school for gifted children meet with Muriel's objection.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry misinterprets Signor Aldo's intentions and jeopardizes Jackie's opportunity to go to Italy and work for the designer.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The ever hustling Paul Deveraux begs Iris and the Rush family to pose as his own family to impress a son he never knew he had.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe's mysterious new girlfriend, Linda turns out to be quite wealthy and old enough to be his mother.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Sara's whirlwind romance with a young advertising executive leaves Henry distraught.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Christian is preparing for his first vacation in years. His plane leaves in an hour but he's lingering at the store. When he learns Edna will be taking over, he has a time of relief, until he learns that her first duty will be a conference in Tokyo. He panics as it's too late to cancel his trip.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Howard stars as a Cubby Cheese Ball in a television commercial promoting Cobb's. Health food fanatics decide to protest the store but it gets out of hand. On his way to the surprise birthday party, Howard finds his entire staff bound, gagged and help hostage by the group.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: A no-frills market opens across the street and starts a price-war. Bannister is caught up in his own problems when Edna takes a vacation to rethink the relationship.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: It's the 7th anniversary of Edna and Howard's first date. Howard was busy and has Alf pick out a present for him, but instead of jewelry he brings back a hamster.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The Harpers quarrel over new home dĂ©cor. Nick takes jobs as a piano tuner and assistant at the hardware shop. Janey and Stupid Brian's relationship reaches a new stage.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The Brookes are expecting a Congressman to drop by and Jeffrey doesn't want the Ropers around when he comes.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen hires Stanley's friend, Joey, to haul out their furniture so she can redecorate. Her brother in law, Hubert, hears of Helen's plan and decides to buy some new furniture. Joey offers to sell his furniture for him and sells it to Stanley. When Helen sees he bought her sister's furniture she freaks out.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Business and politics don't mix well when Mr. Wainwright and Henry campaign for opposing candidates in the State Legislature election.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry's harping on how great Muriel's friend looks after a facelift drives Muriel to the rink of having one herself.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe falls in love with Yvonne, the Rush's new Latin housekeeper. When they decide to marry, Henry suspects Yvonne is only interested in gaining citizenship.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry goes to great lengths to avoid paying five years worth of late charges on some overdue library books.

programme.desc: Henry and Muriel develop problems of their own while playing referee to Marsha and Herb's marriage woes.

programme.desc: Against Iris' wishes, Henry submits a design for the interworld Travel Association's logo.

programme.desc: Henry, Muriel and Andrew move to Marin County. Henry changes professions, Muriel hires a new housekeeper and makes Henry hire Monroe.

programme.desc: The staff start gossip about Marlene and Christian who apparently went home together after an office party.

programme.desc: Bannister is in competition with another store manager for the Vice-President position at Cobb's.

programme.desc: When slow construction starts bringing Cobb's business down, Bannister has to decide two employees to lay off.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Running out of money, Stanley needs to take a job on the killing floor at his brother-in-law Hubert's meat packing plant. Later, his fortunes change when he learns Hubert is planning a secret trip to Acapulco with his secretary.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Larry devises an acid test to see if Furley's latest find is actually a gold-digger.

programme.desc: Jack panics when he suspects Terri's friend wants to give up her life as a nun to marry him.

programme.desc: The trio reluctantly take on former roommate Cindy as their cleaning woman.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack subs for the chef at Angelino's restaurant, where a mobster is so impressed with the bill of fare that he insists Jack be made permanent chef.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's going to be in trouble if Helen finds out he's lost her new puppy "Muffin" on a walk. He decides that a look-alike just might fool her and get him off the hook. Will Stanley get away with it or be barked at by Helen?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The clock Stanley gives Helen for their anniversary turns out to be stolen from Brookes' apartment.
